ARABIC: وَيَدْعُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ بِٱلشَّرِّ دُعَآءَهُۥ بِٱلْخَيْرِ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ عَجُولًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Man prays for evil just as he prays for good. Man is prone to be impetuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Man prays for evil as he prays for good, for man is hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Man prays for evil in the manner he ought to pray for good. Man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: People pray as earnestly to gain evil as one should to gain virtue. But people are hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And man prays for evil like the way he seeks goodness; and man is very hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And man invokes (Allah) for evil as he invokes (Allah) for good and man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And man prays for evil as he ought to pray for good, and man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Man prays for evil, as he prays for good; man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Man prayeth for evil as he prayeth for good; for man was ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet man asks for evil as eagerly as he should ask for good. Truly, man is indeed hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And man prayeth for evil the prayer he should make for good, and man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Man prays for ill as [avidly as] he prays for good, and man is overhasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The prayer that man should make for good, he maketh for evil; for man is given to hasty (deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And man invokes (Allah) for evil as he invokes (Allah) for good and man is ever hasty [i.e., if he is angry with somebody, he invokes (saying): "O Allah! Curse him, etc." and that one should not do, but one should be patient].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet the human prays for evil as he prays for good mankind is always hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The human being prays for evil as he prays for good. The human being is very hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:11] And man prays for ill, against himself and his family when he is frustrated, as [avidly as] he prays for good. And mankind is ever hasty, to pray against himself, without contemplating the consequence thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Man) i.e. al-Nadr Ibn al-Harth (prayeth for evil) prays for curses and chastisement to descend on himself and his family (as he prays for good) as he prays for well-being and mercy; (for man) al-Nadr Ibn al-Harth (was ever hasty) he is hasty to encounter chastisement. 299
